main.name: Fabrice Chabance
main.description: Experienced engineer with a Professional Scrum Master certification seeking a new challenge
main.bio: Over 15 Years of software development experience in a wide variety of languages C++/C#/Java. As much as I love making new features for the projects I work for, I also love proposing new ideas to improve our team efficiency or  new features that could be beneficial to the customer.

resume.skillmessage: The grade provided for the skills below is based on how deep I know the language or the technology.

education.degree: Majored in Cognitive Science and Advanced Computing
education.description: Learned C++/Java common data structures algorithm but also Metaheuristics, Machine learning algorithms such as Neural Networks, SVM, linear regression to name a few.

education.degree: Graduated with a diploma in Science

work.title: Senior software engineer
work.description: One of Japan’s largest bank, it currently holds more than 1.8 trillion dollars in assets.
bullets: Developed new signals and created new automated trading strategies in C++.
Used machine learning with R to predict future performances of stocks.
Created a new UI application to help traders take decisions by visualizing signals.
Improved UI stability by using standard .NET unit testing frameworks and adding KPI to identify bottlenecks.
work.technos: C#, C++, R, Python, Shell script, XML, SVN, Git, Jira

work.company: BANK OF AMERICA MERRILL LYNCH, Tokyo, Japan
work.title: Senior software engineer
work.description: The second largest bank holding company in the United States, it provides a wide range of services like M&A, and equity and debt capital markets.
bullets: Accompanied the company in its process to become agile by actively participating and proposing new ideas during the different SCRUM events.
Developed a new level 2 market data feed handler in APAC.
Improved the Python test framework by developing new tests for order validation and index arbitrage. This decreased the loading time by more than 80% on 40 tests.
Revamped the Index Arbitrage strategy and the user interface to adapt to trader's needs.
Added several commonly used tracking error optimization algorithms to the trading system.

Provided a detailed analysis of the sanity checks with automatically generated daily reports to the 
management.
work.technos: C#, C++, Java, Python, Oracle, Sybase, TCL, FIX, XML, SVN, Git, JIRA

work.title: Director
work.description: A company of 4 employees established in Japan that provided online French lessons and mobile applications.
bullets: Using Agile, we developed four mobile applications for iPhone and Android phones.
The website ranked second in Google search when the words “online French lessons” were used.
Adapted an eLearning solution to be compatible with Japanese and hosted servers on AWS.
work.technos: C#, Flash Builder, PostgreSQL, PHP, HTML, Javascript, JSON, Dokeos, Mantis, AWS

work.company: SOCIETE GENERALE, Tokyo Japan & Hong Kong China
work.title: Quant Developer / Trader
work.description: One of the biggest banks in France, it has a presence in more than eighty countries with around 163,000 employees. The Corporate and Investment Banking branch tailors solutions for raising capital, financing, risk management, and investment.
bullets: Used the LEAN feedback loop to maximize value with release frequencies ranging from two weeks to one day.
Improved PnL for existing high frequency strategies using backtesting and in house machine learning tools.
Managed high frequency IT performance projects to improve each system involved in the trading activity.
Proposed and developed new indicators, which were widely used by other traders.
Developed, enhanced, and tested high frequency systems for Asian markets
Shared research and development ideas with both the IT and the business teams.
work.technos: C#, VBA, XML, Access, Tibco, CVS, Mantis
